headline: Southwest Gas' Centuri unit to seek $1.8B valuation in upcoming IPO
description: Southwest Gas (NYSE:SWX) said Monday it launched a roadshow for the IPO of its Centuri Holdings infrastructure services unit, seeking a valuation of as much as $1.8B. Southwest Gas (SWX) said it will offer 12.4M common shares of Centuri, raising ~$260.4M, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 1.86M share, anticipating an IPO price of $18-$21/share. Funds backed by activist investor Carl Icahn agreed to purchase ~2.6M shares in a concurrent private placement; Icahn Enterprises owns ~15% of Southwest Gas, according to Bloomberg data. Centuri, which has ~12.5K employees and serves 43 US states plus two Canadian provinces, lost $186M on $2.9B in revenues in FY 2023 and lost $168M on $2.8B in sales in FY 2022, SEC filings showed. The company has been approved to list its shares on the NYSE under the CTRI ticker symbol.  More on Southwest Gas  Southwest Gas Q4 2023 Earnings Call Transcript Southwest Gas Q4 2023 Results - Earnings Call Presentation Southwest Gas Could Face A Customer Uprising

headline: Norwegian Cruise Lines places its largest order for 8 new ships
description: Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings (NYSE:NCLH), the third-largest cruise operator, has ordered eight new ships for its three brands, the largest order in the company’s history. The ships are scheduled to be delivered over a 10-year period with four 200K ton ships with a capacity for 5K guests each to be delivered from 2030 to 2036. Oceania Cruises will take delivery of two 86K gross-ton ships with a capacity of 1,450 guests each in 2027 and 2029, while Regent Seven Seas will take delivery of two 77K gross-ton ships with a capacity of 850 guests each in 2026 and 2029. Norwegian (NCLH) currently operates a fleet of 32 ships with room for over 66K passengers. The ships will be made by Italian shipbuilder Fincantieri.  Along with the new ships, the company is also adding a new pier at its Great Stirrup Cay port at its private island in the Bahamas. The pier is expected to be complete by late 2025. “We expect these strategic investments will secure our growth trajectory, significantly boost our earnings profile, and enhance shareholder value well into the future. With a favorable payment structure that includes pre-delivery financing and modest initial installment payments, we still anticipate strong net leverage reduction of 1.5 turns by the end of 2024, relative to 2023,” CFO Mark Kempa said. Last month, Norwegian (NCLH) reported a 32% jump in FY23 revenue versus the pre-pandemic level, while revenue per passenger cruise day increased 17% from 2019. Additionally, advance ticket sales balance ended 2023 at a year-end record of $3.2B, up 56% from 2019.    More on Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings  Norwegian Cruise Line: Upside Remains Huge And Dilution Risks Exaggerated Deleveraging Efforts And More Ships Make Norwegian Cruise A Buy Norwegian Cruise Line: Ride Recovery Even Higher Cruise line stocks rally after solid outlook from Norwegian Cruise Line Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Non-GAAP EPS of -$0.18 misses by $0.04, revenue of $1.99B beats by $30M

headline: Maxeon Solar sinks after guiding Q4 and Q1 revenues below consensus
description: Maxeon Solar Technologies (NASDAQ:MAXN) -8.8% post-market Monday after issuing some preliminary Q4 results, including revenues of $229M, below $236.8M analyst consensus estimate, an adjusted EBITDA loss of $35M and total shipments of 653 MW. In the year-earlier quarter, Maxeon's (MAXN) revenues totaled $324M, adjusted EBITDA came in at a loss of $4M and shipments totaled 734 MW. Maxeon (MAXN) said it has been executing a transformation of its IBC capacity timed to coincide with the current DG market slowdown, as disclosed in its previous earnings call, and "as part of this initiative, we made the decision to ramp down all of our Maxeon 6 capacity faster than we had originally expected, resulting in higher than initially planned restructuring costs" in Q4. For Q1, Maxeon (MAXN) guided for $186M in revenues, well below the $241.5M consensus estimate, with total shipments of 508 MW. headline: Bloom Energy wins up to $75M in U.S. tax credits for Fremont plant
description: Bloom Energy (NYSE:BE) +2.8% post-market Monday after saying it was awarded up to $75M in federal tax credits to expand fuel cell and electrolyzer production capacity and advance operating efficiency at its multi-GW Fremont, California, manufacturing plant. The funding is part of $4B in tax credits announced by the Biden administration to accelerate domestic clean energy manufacturing and reduce greenhouse gas emissions at industrial facilities. Bloom Energy's (BE) 164K sq ft Fremont plant, which opened in 2022, expanded the company's footprint to more than 524K sq ft; the facility can produce more than 1 GW/year, the equivalent capacity of adding a nuclear power plant every year. "The $75M tax credit, equaling up to 30% of expenditures to expand the Fremont capacity, recognizes our commitment to scaling domestic manufacturing," Bloom Energy (BE) COO Satish Chitoori said. headline: Harmonic announces CEO succession, updates Q1 revenue guidance
description: Harmonic (NASDAQ:HLIT) announced that Patrick Harshman will retire as President and CEO, effective June 11, 2024. Nimrod Ben-Natan has been appointed as Harshman's successor by Harmonic's Board of Directors. Harmonic management now expects total company first quarter 2024 revenue to be in the range of $121M to $123M.  Harmonic expects revenue between $78.5M to $79.5M for the Broadband segment and revenue between $42.5M to $43.5M for the Video segment. As previously announced in October 2023, Harmonic's Board initiated a formal strategic review process to evaluate potential strategic alternatives for the company's Video business. The Board concluded its review and determined that current market conditions do not support its value creation objectives for the Video business. The go-forward strategy for Harmonic's video business will be centered on driving profitable growth by focusing on scalable market opportunities, streamlining operations and optimizing its cost structure. Source: Press Release.   More on Harmonic  Harmonic Inc. (HLIT) Q4 2023 Earnings Call Transcript Harmonic: Upcoming Report Worthwhile To Be Bullish On Harmonic loses ground despite beating EPS estimates as forecast misses Seeking Alpha’s Quant Rating on Harmonic Historical earnings data for Harmonic

headline: ASUR says passenger traffic rose 6.6% in March
description: Grupo Aeroportuario del Sureste (NYSE:ASR) on Monday said passenger traffic for March 2024 reached a total of 6.5 million passengers, representing an increase of 6.6% compared to March 2023. Passenger traffic presented year-on-year increases of 3.4% in Mexico, 16.0% in Puerto Rico and 9.4% in Colombia.  Passenger traffic growth in Mexico was driven by an 11.1% increase in international traffic that offset a 6.83% decrease in domestic traffic. Puerto Rico reported growth in domestic and international traffic, 14.9% and 27.1%, respectively. Passenger traffic in Colombia reported growth in domestic and international traffic of 3.6% and 37.7%, respectively. Source: Press Release. headline: Allbirds receives Nasdaq notice of non-compliance
description: Allbirds (NASDAQ:BIRD) said on Monday it had received a Nasdaq notice that the company was no longer in compliance with the stock exchange's listing rules. According to the Nasdaq notice, the closing bid price of the BIRD's Class A common stock has fallen below $1.00 per share for 30 consecutive days.  In accordance with Nasdaq listing rules, BIRD has 180 calendar days from the date of the Notice, or until September 30, 2024, to regain compliance with the minimum bid price requirement. The company intends to actively monitor the bid price of its Class A common stock and will consider actions that it may take in response to this notification in order to regain compliance with the continued listing requirements.  Press Release.   More on Allbirds  Allbirds, Inc. headline: Energy Transfer files for FERC review in pipeline dispute with Williams
description: Energy Transfer (NYSE:ET) has asked the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to take a closer review of Williams' (WMB) Louisiana Energy Gateway pipeline project, Bloomberg reported Monday, as a legal battle continues between the two companies. Energy Transfer (ET) said Williams (WMB) is constructing interstate transmission pipeline facilities in Texas and Louisiana without first seeking necessary approval, and asked FERC to clarify how it applies tests to determine whether a facility needs a public interest period and a review under the National Environmental Policy Act, according to the report. Energy Transfer (ET) owns a key stretch of pipelines across east Texas and Louisiana and seeks to expand its Gulf Run system to meet booming demand for liquefied natural gas along Louisiana's coast. "Energy Transfer's FERC complaint is another step by Energy Transfer to stifle competition in Louisiana," Williams (WMB) told Bloomberg. Williams' (WMB) Louisiana Energy Gateway project would add 1.8B cf/of capacity; service is planned for launch by H2 2025.  More on Energy Transfer  Energy Transfer: Fundamentals Keep Improving Energy Transfer: Moving America's Energy At ~40% Discount To Peers Energy Transfer: Another Base Hit

headline: Genco Shipping holder George Economou to nominate one candidate for board
description: Genco Shipping & Trading (NYSE:GNK) holder George Economou formally filed a proxy to nominate one candidate for the shipping company's board. Genco fell 1.9%. Economou, via his affiliated investment vehicles, has a ~5.4% ownership stake in the company, and filed to nominate Robert Pons to the board, according to a proxy statement on Monday. Economou is also calling for the removal of incumbent director James G. Dolphin, who has been on the board for ten years. "The GK Parties also believe that the performance of the common shares has consistently lagged net asset value in part because of a failure of the company to return a sufficient portion of its excess cash to shareholders, which, the GK Parties believe, would support the stock price both in the short term and in the longer term and therefore help create shareholder value," Economou said in the filing.  The filing comes after Economou in January originally said he nominated two directors for the Genco (GNK) board. Genco last month said it rejected the investor's nominees and reiterated its thoughts in a proxy statement on Wednesday. "Following engagement with Mr. Economou and a thorough evaluation of his nominees, the board unanimously rejected the proposed nominations and determined that including them would neither be additive to our already strong, focused and experienced Board nor in the best interests of the company or its shareholders," Genco said in the statement on Wednesday. headline: PFAS ban in EU and U.S. could have negative implications for Amer Sports - analyst
description: Shares of Amer Sports (NYSE:AS) closed more than 5% lower Monday as an impending ban on polyfluoroalkyl substances, or PFAS, led Bernstein analyst Melinda Hu to downgrade the stock to Market Perform from Outperform. Per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances, also known as “forever chemicals” because of their longevity in the environment, are used in sportswear fabrics to make them water- and stain-resistant.  Although the Centers for Disease Control considers skin contact with PFAS a minor source of exposure, the U.S. and Europe are moving towards implementing a ban on PFAS in 2025 and 2026, respectively. The negative implications from a PFAS ban on apparel made by the Arc’teryx brand – which was sold to Amer Sports (AS) in 2005 – could lead to negative earnings and multiple revisions from the company, Hu said in her research note. Hu also lowered her price target for Amer Sports (AS) by 13.5% to $16.   More on Amer Sports, Inc. headline: Lawmakers want FTC, DOJ to 'closely scrutinize' proposed sale of Steward's doctor group
description: Steward Health Care, Medical Properties Trust's (NYSE:MPW) largest operator, proposed late last month to sell its physician network to UnitedHealth's (UNH) Optum Care arm, a deal that U.S. lawmakers on Monday urged regulators to "closely scrutinize." In a letter, Senators Elizabeth Warren (D-MA), Edward J. Markey (D-MA) and the Massachusetts delegation requested Lina Khan, chair of the Federal Trade Commission, and Department of Justice Assistant Attorney General Jonathan Kanter to carefully review the planned deal, "and oppose it if it would drive up health care costs or reduce patients’ quality of care in violation of antitrust law." The deal would help indebted Steward to resolve its immediate financial issues and allow it to repay all outstanding obligations to Medical Properties Trust (MPW). "This proposed merger, however, does not guarantee [Steward's hospitals] will stay open in the long-run, and in the meantime could lead to more expensive health care for vulnerable patients and create more opportunities for UnitedHealth to pad its profits with taxpayer dollars," the lawmakers wrote. The lawmakers laid out the anticompetitive impacts of the deal, noting that UnitedHealth (UNH) already has "massive market power" and this merger would further expand its consolidation of the market.   More on Medical Properties  Medical Properties Trust Q4: Wouldn't Touch This REIT With A 10-Foot Pole Medical Properties Trust: Improving Liquidity And Managing Risk Medical Properties Trust's Weakest Link May Be Its Greatest Asset Ahead - Prospective Reversal Medical Properties Trust snaps six-day losing streak, trades in the green Medical Properties Trust to shrink in size with lower earnings, analyst says

headline: IQVIA and Salesforce expand partnership to accelerate life sciences cloud development
description: IQVIA (NYSE:IQV) and Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) announced an expanded global strategic partnership to accelerate the development of Salesforce’s Life Sciences Cloud, a customer engagement platform for the global life sciences industry. Building on the IQVIA Orchestrated Customer Engagement platform, launched in 2017, the partnership will apply innovations from IQVIA OCE with Salesforce’s Life Sciences Cloud to provide customers with a new single, end-to-end engagement platform.  As part of the expanded partnership, IQVIA will license the OCE CRM related software to Salesforce, and the parties will collaborate to accelerate development of Life Sciences Cloud for customer engagement, expected to be available in 2025. IQVIA will continue to market the OCE CRM product and will support its nearly 400 global OCE customers in 130+ countries through 2029. IQVIA will work with Salesforce to jointly market the new offering. headline: Medical Properties Trust snaps six-day losing streak, trades in the green
description: Medical Properties Trust (NYSE:MPW) shares traded in the green on Monday, breaking a six-day losing spell. Stock closed up 0.99% at $4.09 MPW has fallen 51.25% in the last 12 months, and 9.03% in the last one month. YTD, the stock has trailed way behind the broader S&P 500 market which rose 9.11% as compared to MPW’s YTD loss of 17.52%. Looking at Seeking Alpha's Quant Ratings, this Alabama based REIT has a Strong Sell rating with a score of 1.26 out of 5. When it comes to Wall Street analysis, 5 out of 12 analysts recommend a Hold, 3 rate it as a Sell, 2 rate it as a Buy and 2 rate it as a Strong Sell. Seeking Alpha analysts have a Hold rating on the company. Truist analyst Michael Lewis said today that he expects Medical Properties Trust to "eventually be smaller with lower earnings," amid high uncertainty over what the REIT may look like in the future. SA analyst The Dividend Collectuh says, “The company's dividend is at high risk of being cut or eliminated due to liquidity issues and a high payout ratio. FFO declined year-over-year by 69%. MPW's leverage level has increased, indicating potential challenges in the future. Overall, I rate this REIT a strong sell.” For Q1, analysts expect MPW revenue of $284.66M on FFO of $0.24   More on Medical Properties  Medical Properties Trust Q4: Wouldn't Touch This REIT With A 10-Foot Pole Medical Properties Trust: Improving Liquidity And Managing Risk Medical Properties Trust's Weakest Link May Be Its Greatest Asset Ahead - Prospective Reversal Medical Properties Trust to shrink in size with lower earnings, analyst says Medical Properties Trust's tenant Steward to sell doctor network to UnitedHealth - report

headline: Nasdaq, S&P, and Dow, ended unchanged while yields moved up
description: Wall Street’s major market averages ended unchanged on Monday while Treasury yields continued their upward climb. Investors now shift their eyes to this week’s inflation print which is scheduled for Wednesday in the form of the CPI report. The tech focused Nasdaq Composite (COMP:IND) concluded +0.03%, the benchmark S&P 500 (SP500) ended -0.04%, and the blue-chip Dow Jones (DJI) finished -0.03%. On a sector-by sector stance, five of the 11 S&P segments closed out Monday on top with the Real Estate and Consumer Discretionary sectors leading the way higher. In reverse, the two worst performing areas of the market were Energy and Health Care. Furthermore, U.S. Treasury yields were able to advance again. The shorter end U.S. 2 Year Treasury yield (US2Y) advanced by 4 basis points to 4.79%. At the same time the longer end U.S. 10 Year Treasury yield (US10Y) moved up by 2 basis points to 4.42%. See how other yields trade across the entire yield curve here. Looking at the commodities, and investors will have noticed that oil prices eased and gold topped another all-time trading high. UBS now sees the precious metal topping $2,500 by year-end. The economic calendar was empty on Monday but Wall Street is set to receive the consumer price index for March on Wednesday and economists are predicting a 3.4% Y/Y rise. "A hot inflation print for March can force the Fed to adopt a more hawkish monetary policy stance. With equity markets sitting at historically elevated levels, rate cuts getting taken off the calendar could spark a broad market pullback in the near-to-medium term,” Ahan Vashi, Investing Group leader of the Quantamental Investor stated. "How fast the US economy is growing, and how fast inflation is falling, will determine how soon the Fed cuts rates, and that in turn will play a big role in determining rate/yield differentials," said Kit Juckes, F/X strategist at SocGen. "A slip in core CPI inflation 3.7% y/y and a 0.3% monthly gain won’t really feed expectations of a June hike much after last week’s solid data dented them. Market expectations are drifting in favor of a cut in July rather than June and it’s easy to see why," Juckes added. "Inflation concerns also meant that Treasury yields reached their highest levels since November across the curve," said Deutsche Bank's Henry Allen.  More on Markets  Wells Fargo ups its year-end S&P 500 target to 5,535 The S&P 500's Path Back To 4,100 In 2024 Week Ahead: Strong U.S. Jobs Data Failed To Sustain Dollar Rally, Can The March CPI Do Better? headline: Shell stock closes in green for a seventh consecutive day
description: Shell plc (NYSE:SHEL) closed in green for a seventh consecutive day after having gained 6.3% over the last six trading sessions. Shares of the oil and gas giant hit a 52-week high of $72.02 on Monday before closing +0.7% at $71.82. The stock has gained 20% in value in the last 12 months.  SHEL has closed in the green for all trading days in April so far. In March, it closed positively for 15 out of 20 sessions. Seeking Alpha's Quant rating system has given SHEL a "Hold" rating with a score of 3.40 out of 5. The company has been graded A+ for profitability and C+ for momentum, while its growth and valuation prospects have been graded D and C+, respectively. Turning to the Wall Street community, five analysts have given SHEL a "Strong Buy", while six are "Buy" on the stock. Four analysts have given the stock a "Hold" recommendation. The company has no "Sell" ratings.  Seeking Alpha analysts, on average, see the stock as a "Buy". SA contributor White Star Research wrote in their March 28 report, "Following its Capital Markets Day 2023 and the appointment of new CEO Sawan, Shell has lowered the pace of its energy transition and now aims at stable production through 2030. Next to best-in-class deepwater assets in the Gulf of Mexico and Brazil, Shell has a dominant position in LNG at ~17% of global supply, supported by a highly visible pipeline. Due to its dominance in production and storage capacity, Shell's LNG trading is in a highly advantaged position to exploit global price arbitrage, alone contributing ~$2.4B in Q4 net profit. I am highly bullish on Shell's leverage to benefit from growing demand in LNG and realize higher natural gas prices in Asian and European markets. Initiate at Overweight (PT $90)."   More on Shell  Shell: Higher Reserve And An Attractive Valuation Shell: Earnings Report Is More Positive Than Not Shell lifts Q1 gas production guidance, sees lower gas trading results Shell seeks longer license from U.S. before FID on Venezuela gas project - Reuters

headline: Nike snaps six-day losing streak
description: Nike (NYSE:NKE) shares snapped their six-day losing streak on Monday, closing 1.2% higher at $90.01.  The sportswear maker has lost nearly 27% in the last 12-months, compared to the ~27% gain of the broader S&P 500 Index. Looking at Seeking Alpha's Quant Ratings, Nike has a Hold rating with a score of 3.18 out of 5. The company scored an A+ for profitability, a B+ for revisions, but only managed an F for valuation.  Turning to the Wall Street community, 24 out of 39 analysts rate the stock as a Buy or higher, 12 rate it as a Hold, and three rate it as a Sell or lower.  Seeking Alpha analysts at large consider the stock a Hold. According to SA analyst Grant Gigliotti, "While facing challenges, Nike remains a strong brand with the potential for a resurgence in strength by the end of 2024 or the beginning of 2025." March was not a favorable month for the company, with eight sessions in the green and 12 sessions in the red.
